bibl.title: Letter from G.H. Hazlehurst to Henry Rose Carter, September 12, 1922

div1.p: Hazlehurst seeks Carter's advice on a draft of Regulations Governing the Impounding of Waters, which he is anxious to have passed by the State Board of Health.

div1.head: Letter from G.H. Hazlehurst to Henry Rose Carter, September 12, 1922
div1.opener:
ALABAMA
GREAT SEAL
S. W. WELCH, M. D.
STATE HEALTH OFFICER
FANNIE K. CENTERFIT,
SECRETARY
Im'd water
Ala
BUREAUS:
VITAL STATISTICS
HYGIENIC LABORATORY
ENGINEERING
COUNTY ORGANIZATION
VENEREAL DISEASE CONTROL
CHILD HYGIENE AND PUBLIC
HEALTH NURSING
EPIDEMIOLOGY
INSPECTION
PUBLICITY AND
EDUCATION
Alabama State Board of Health
STATE CAPITOL
Montgomery
Sept. 12th, 1922.
N. M. C
Im'd water
Ala. State Board
Dr. H. R. Carter, Senior Surgeon,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor:-
div1.p:
We are enclosing herewith,
Regulations Governing the Impounding of Waters which,
in the rough, were the work of Mr. J. A. LePrince and
Dr. H.T.D. Griffitts. Please give these your construc-
tive criticisms, making any addition or changes you see
fit.

We have seven impounded projects
coming up shortly and are anxious to get these Regulations
passed by the State Board of Health. We would therefore,
appreciate your returning same as soon as possible.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, G. H. Hazlehurst,
Chief Sanitary Engineer. GHH:E
